page.title: 03THE OUNDLE BY-PASS
page.content: Oundle town_centre has been a bottle-neck for traffc and the road going through the centre was just not big enough. Oundle by-pass will take traffic going on the Peterborough - Northampton road <A605> away from the town. It will follow the route of the old railway-line. It leaves the old road via a new roundabout built to the north-east of the town and then rejoins the old road near Barnwell village. The road has to cross the river twice so two bridges are being built. Traffic from the Corby direction will still have to go through the town-centre. Oundle has waited over thirty years for this by-pass.There was much debate about the route to be taken. Some residents are afraid that the loss of traffic will kill the town. Others are looking forward to some peace and quiet!
